content: in next 4 st* repeat until the end of the round slip_stitch into first single_crochet 19 ch1 single_crochet in the same st single_crochet in each st of the round slip_stitch into the first single_crochet 20 ch1 single_crochet in the same st single_crochet in the next 5 st *placing a d-ring on the inside of the bag single_crochet in the next 4 st around the d-ring* single_crochet in the next 14 st **repeat starred** single_crochet in the next 18 st **repeat starred** single_crochet in the next 14 st **repeat starred** single_crochet in the last 10 st a theringsthatiusedare3mm ifyoursareadifferentsize youmayneedtoadjusthowmanysc areusedtoholdtheminplace b placementofthehandles/d-ringsdoesnotneedtobeexact youmayfindthatyouwouldlikethem closertogetherorfurtherapart sotheaboveisjustaguideline handles make two 1 ch5 single_crochet in the 2nd chain from your hook single_crochet in the remaining 3 2 ch1 single_crochet in each of the 4 st 3 repeat 4 repeat hooke�b�maxin� 5 repeat 6 take your work and thread it through your first ring fold it upwards so that both ends are touching ch1 single_crochet the ends together 7 ch1 single_crochet in each of the 4 st 8 repeat for the next 30 row a youcanaddmorerowsifyouwouldlikealongerhandle 9 cut a very very long tail - longer than you think you need 10 keeping your handle flat thread it through the adjacent ring fold your work upwards so that the end is touching the inside of the handle ch1 slip_stitch across to attach it together 11 going along the edge of the handle slip_stitch up 2 or 3 row then fold the edges together and single_crochet until you reach the end of the handle 12 cut and weave in your ends
